item.title: Jean add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "The longest way must have its close - the gloomiest night will wear on to a morning." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Jean add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Jean add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Jean add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "It was the kind of pure, undiffused light that can only come from a really hot blue sky, the kind that makes even a concrete highway painful to behold and turns every distant reflective surface into a little glint of flame. Do you know how sometimes on very fine days the sun will shine with a particular intensity that makes the most mundane objects in the landscape glow with an unusual radiance, so that buildings and structures you normally pass without a glance suddenly become arresting, even beautiful? Well, they seem to have that light in Australia nearly all the time." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Jean add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "The apparition of these faces in the crowd; Petals on a wet black bough." -- Ezra Pound
